speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: ACT III

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: SCENE I. London. QUEEN KATHARINE's apartments.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Enter QUEEN KATHARINE and her Women, as at work

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Take thy lute, wench: my soul grows sad with troubles;

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Sing, and disperse 'em, if thou canst: leave working.

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: SONG

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Orpheus with his lute made trees,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: And the mountain tops that freeze,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Bow themselves when he did sing:

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: To his music plants and flowers

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Ever sprung; as sun and showers

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: There had made a lasting spring.

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Every thing that heard him play,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Even the billows of the sea,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Hung their heads, and then lay by.

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: In sweet music is such art,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Killing care and grief of heart

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Fall asleep, or hearing, die.

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Enter a Gentleman

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: How now!

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: An't please your grace, the two great cardinals

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Wait in the presence.

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Would they speak with me?

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: They will'd me say so, madam.

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Pray their graces

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: To come near.

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Exit Gentleman

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: What can be their business

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: With me, a poor weak woman, fall'n from favour?

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: I do not like their coming. Now I think on't,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: They should be good men; their affairs as righteous:

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: But all hoods make not monks.

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Enter CARDINAL WOLSEY and CARDINAL CAMPEIUS

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Peace to your highness!

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Your graces find me here part of a housewife,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: I would be all, against the worst may happen.

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: What are your pleasures with me, reverend lords?

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: May it please you noble madam, to withdraw

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Into your private chamber, we shall give you

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: The full cause of our coming.

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Speak it here:

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: There's nothing I have done yet, o' my conscience,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Deserves a corner: would all other women

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Could speak this with as free a soul as I do!

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: My lords, I care not, so much I am happy

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Above a number, if my actions

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Were tried by every tongue, every eye saw 'em,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Envy and base opinion set against 'em,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: I know my life so even. If your business

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Seek me out, and that way I am wife in,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Out with it boldly: truth loves open dealing.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Tanta est erga te mentis integritas, regina

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: serenissima,--

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: O, good my lord, no Latin;

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: I am not such a truant since my coming,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: As not to know the language I have lived in:

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: A strange tongue makes my cause more strange,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: suspicious;

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Pray, speak in English: here are some will thank you,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: If you speak truth, for their poor mistress' sake;

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Believe me, she has had much wrong: lord cardinal,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: The willing'st sin I ever yet committed

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: May be absolved in English.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Noble lady,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: I am sorry my integrity should breed,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: And service to his majesty and you,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: So deep suspicion, where all faith was meant.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: We come not by the way of accusation,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: To taint that honour every good tongue blesses,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Nor to betray you any way to sorrow,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: You have too much, good lady; but to know

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: How you stand minded in the weighty difference

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Between the king and you; and to deliver,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Like free and honest men, our just opinions

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: And comforts to your cause.

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: Most honour'd madam,

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: My Lord of York, out of his noble nature,

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: Zeal and obedience he still bore your grace,

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: Forgetting, like a good man your late censure

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: Both of his truth and him, which was too far,

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: Offers, as I do, in a sign of peace,

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: His service and his counsel.

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: [Aside] To betray me.--

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: My lords, I thank you both for your good wills;

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Ye speak like honest men; pray God, ye prove so!

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: But how to make ye suddenly an answer,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: In such a point of weight, so near mine honour,--

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: More near my life, I fear,--with my weak wit,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: And to such men of gravity and learning,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: In truth, I know not. I was set at work

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Among my maids: full little, God knows, looking

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Either for such men or such business.

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: For her sake that I have been,--for I feel

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: The last fit of my greatness,--good your graces,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Let me have time and counsel for my cause:

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Alas, I am a woman, friendless, hopeless!

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Madam, you wrong the king's love with these fears:

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Your hopes and friends are infinite.

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: In England

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: But little for my profit: can you think, lords,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: That any Englishman dare give me counsel?

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Or be a known friend, 'gainst his highness' pleasure,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Though he be grown so desperate to be honest,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: And live a subject? Nay, forsooth, my friends,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: They that must weigh out my afflictions,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: They that my trust must grow to, live not here:

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: They are, as all my other comforts, far hence

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: In mine own country, lords.

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: I would your grace

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: Would leave your griefs, and take my counsel.

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: How, sir?

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: Put your main cause into the king's protection;

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: He's loving and most gracious: 'twill be much

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: Both for your honour better and your cause;

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: For if the trial of the law o'ertake ye,

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: You'll part away disgraced.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: He tells you rightly.

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Ye tell me what ye wish for both,--my ruin:

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Is this your Christian counsel? out upon ye!

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Heaven is above all yet; there sits a judge

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: That no king can corrupt.

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: Your rage mistakes us.

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: The more shame for ye: holy men I thought ye,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Upon my soul, two reverend cardinal virtues;

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: But cardinal sins and hollow hearts I fear ye:

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Mend 'em, for shame, my lords. Is this your comfort?

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: The cordial that ye bring a wretched lady,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: A woman lost among ye, laugh'd at, scorn'd?

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: I will not wish ye half my miseries;

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: I have more charity: but say, I warn'd ye;

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Take heed, for heaven's sake, take heed, lest at once

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: The burthen of my sorrows fall upon ye.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Madam, this is a mere distraction;

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: You turn the good we offer into envy.

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Ye turn me into nothing: woe upon ye

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: And all such false professors! would you have me--

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: If you have any justice, any pity;

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: If ye be any thing but churchmen's habits--

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Put my sick cause into his hands that hates me?

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Alas, has banish'd me his bed already,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: His love, too long ago! I am old, my lords,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: And all the fellowship I hold now with him

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Is only my obedience. What can happen

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: To me above this wretchedness? all your studies

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Make me a curse like this.

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: Your fears are worse.

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Have I lived thus long--let me speak myself,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Since virtue finds no friends--a wife, a true one?

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: A woman, I dare say without vain-glory,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Never yet branded with suspicion?

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Have I with all my full affections

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Still met the king? loved him next heaven?

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: obey'd him?

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Been, out of fondness, superstitious to him?

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Almost forgot my prayers to content him?

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: And am I thus rewarded? 'tis not well, lords.

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Bring me a constant woman to her husband,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: One that ne'er dream'd a joy beyond his pleasure;

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: And to that woman, when she has done most,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Yet will I add an honour, a great patience.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Madam, you wander from the good we aim at.

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: My lord, I dare not make myself so guilty,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: To give up willingly that noble title

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Your master wed me to: nothing but death

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Shall e'er divorce my dignities.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Pray, hear me.

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Would I had never trod this English earth,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Or felt the flatteries that grow upon it!

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Ye have angels' faces, but heaven knows your hearts.

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: What will become of me now, wretched lady!

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: I am the most unhappy woman living.

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Alas, poor wenches, where are now your fortunes!

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Shipwreck'd upon a kingdom, where no pity,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: No friend, no hope; no kindred weep for me;

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Almost no grave allow'd me: like the lily,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: That once was mistress of the field and flourish'd,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: I'll hang my head and perish.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: If your grace

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Could but be brought to know our ends are honest,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: You'ld feel more comfort: why should we, good lady,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Upon what cause, wrong you? alas, our places,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: The way of our profession is against it:

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: We are to cure such sorrows, not to sow 'em.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: For goodness' sake, consider what you do;

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: How you may hurt yourself, ay, utterly

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Grow from the king's acquaintance, by this carriage.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: The hearts of princes kiss obedience,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: So much they love it; but to stubborn spirits

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: They swell, and grow as terrible as storms.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: I know you have a gentle, noble temper,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: A soul as even as a calm: pray, think us

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Those we profess, peace-makers, friends, and servants.

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: Madam, you'll find it so. You wrong your virtues

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: With these weak women's fears: a noble spirit,

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: As yours was put into you, ever casts

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: Such doubts, as false coin, from it. The king loves you;

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: Beware you lose it not: for us, if you please

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: To trust us in your business, we are ready

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: To use our utmost  studies in your service.

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Do what ye will, my lords: and, pray, forgive me,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: If I have used myself unmannerly;

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: You know I am a woman, lacking wit

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: To make a seemly answer to such persons.

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Pray, do my service to his majesty:

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: He has my heart yet; and shall have my prayers

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: While I shall have my life. Come, reverend fathers,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Bestow your counsels on me: she now begs,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: That little thought, when she set footing here,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: She should have bought her dignities so dear.

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Exeunt
